message.content:
cs.LG, cs.SY, cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.NE 

The paper proposes a methodology for end-to-end learning and control tasks, which involves differentiating the Pontryagin's Maximum Principle and constructing two separate control systems. This methodology is applicable to a large class of learning and control problems, including inverse optimization, system identification, and control/planning. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LG (Machine Learning), followed by cs.SY (Systems and Control), cs.RO (Robotics), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing).
